statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Hofstra 55, Drexel 53 (OT)
article.story: PHILADELPHIA (AP) -- Carlos Rivera hit a jump shot with 36 seconds remaining in overtime as Hofstra beat Drexel 55-53 Thursday night and snapped the Dragons' 10-game winning streak. The Pride (12-4, 5-0 Colonial Athletic Association) scored the last seven points in the game and won their sixth straight. Hofstra has won 12 of 13. Antoine Agudio scored three points in overtime and finished with 26, and teammate Loren Stokes hit seven free throws and added 13 points for Hofstra. Dominick Mejia hit four 3-pointers and scored 21 points for Drexel (12-3, 4-1), which shot a season-low 29.4 percent and lost for the first time in six home games. Bashir Mason added 13 points. Frank Elegar, who scored all 10 of Drexel's points in overtime, hit a free throw with 2:56 remaining in overtime to give the Dragons a 53-48 lead before Hofstra rallied. Mejia sent the game to overtime when he hit three free throws with 13 seconds left in regulation, tying the game at 48. The Pride trailed most of the second half, but took a 43-42 lead with 5:35 remaining when Chris Gadley hit a pair of free throws. Mason hit a 3-pointer with 12:14 remaining in regulation to give Drexel a 34-28 lead, which tied its largest lead of the half. The Dragons led 21-20 at the break despite not scoring a field goal in the final 13:31. Hofstra had its own scoring troubles in the first half. The Pride went 7:56 without a field goal but ended the drought on a layup by Rivera with 5:08 remaining.
